creator: bourfran@cognicase.ca
text:
I run Tomcat 3.2.1 on Solaris 2.8 with the JServ disable to let Apache that 
come with Oracle Internet Application Server 9i running and doing the web work 
(html page).

What I saw is keep the status "up and running" (startup) from "before" to go 
back home after the work day and when I come back in the morning, Tomcat is 
down.  Naturally, the first time I though it should be somebody else that touch 
it but I learn than nobody touch it.  so I decide to do some real stress test 
and conclude than it really turn down the day after.

This solution was choosed for a eCommerce Solution, I cannot imagine running 
Tomcat online if it turn down by itself.  Do you have any ideas how to resolve 
that issue???  And we are running on time so if we have to change the 
solution "to run" servlets and JSP, please tell me ASAP.

Thank you very much,

Sincerely,

Francois-Yanick Bourassa
bourfran@'cognicase.ca

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
There isn't enough detail to determine the nature of the problem, so I'm
resolving this bug as "invalid".  Please give a newer Tomcat a try, 3.2.2 (which
is very close to release), Tomcat 3.3, or Tomcat 4.0 and see if you can
reproduce the bug.  If it still occurs, enter a new bug against the Tomcat
you tested.  There have been a lot of bug fixes, so there is hope that the
one causing your problem has been fixed.
